Recipe.Description: Roasted standing rib pork roast, filled with wild rice.

Method.Step: Mist roast with water, or wipe down with a wet cloth, so it will be 'sticky' when you ... season it with salt and pepper.
Place roast, bone end up, on a rack (use one of the grates from your grill, eh?) over a shallow roasting pan. Cover ends of bones with Aluminum foil.
Place roast in oven an reduce heat to 350F.
Cook roast (~20 minutes/lb) until internal temperature reaches 150 (yes, yes, it will be cooked more later . . .), then remove from oven.
Drain dripping from pan and reserve, chill and degrease.
Remove roast from rack and set directly in pan, arranging it in a circle, as-if a 'crown'.
Place stuffing in center of roast, cover stuffing with aluminum foil.
Melt currant jelly in sauce pan with butter.
Return roast to oven to continue roasting, basting every 20 minutes with jelly, until internal temperature reaches 170F.
Remove from oven, let stand for 10 minutes, while you make sauce:
Remove all but 1-2 tblsp fat from the pan drippings.
Heat pan over medium heat and deglaze with wine.
Add shallots and stock, reduce by half.
Swirl 1 tblsp butter to finish (mont au beurre).
Season with salt and pepper, strain through a chinois, add parsley.
Remove foil from roast, garnish tips of bones with kumquats.
Serve with Tourneed Carrots glazed with basil and Cranberry Coulis.
